meta.description: Sustainable solutions for Haiti's waste problem

title.catchphrase: A sustainable solution to Haiti's waste problem.
title.amount: Our goal is to raise $3M USD in capital to get our project launched in 2018.
title.return: Our financial projections anticipate seeing a 100% ROI in less than 3 years. Investors can expect to receive annual dividends as well.
title.investor_signup_2: Be the first to receive news and updates!
title.portal_what_is: The partner portal allows Lakay Vèt to engage directly with investors and other partners both internationally and in Haiti. It will not only facilitate investment, but also provide partners with company performance reports and metrics so that they can stay engaged and monitor performance aspects of the company.
title.risk: The owners of Lakay Vèt are teaming up with success Haitian business people to ensure we set our project up for success in Haiti.

section_body.biogas: Biogas is produced as a byproduct of the anaerobic biodigestion process and can be used to generate electricity and cooking fuel.
section_body.biofertilizer: Biofertilizer is produced as a byproduct of the anaerobic biodigestion process and is used as an affordable nutrient-rich supplement to increase crop yields for Haitian farmers.
section_body.nonBiodegradables: Non-Biodegradable waste like plastics and metals are sorted, cleaned and recycled. We are looking to expand our domestic recycling capabilities to create opportunities for domestic manufacturing.
section_body.consulting: Our consulting services focus on helping businesses and municipalities throughout Haiti find sustainable resource management solutions that are appropriate technologically, infrastructurally and socially for the region.
section_body.feasibility_assessments: We provide high quality feasibility assessments for resource management throughout Haiti. Our team is equip with the knowledge, equipment and resources to test and analyze waste composition, biogas production potential, biofertilizer production potential, social and health impacts of waste processing facilities, and more.
section_body.contracting: Our contracting services range from design and construction of anaerobic biodigestion facilities to operation and maintenence of the systems. We also design and install systems for recyling plastics an other non-organic materials.
section_body.contact_us: Please submit quote requests and other questions to info@lakayvet.com
section_body.contact: Please email us with any questions or feedback.

form.amount_help: Please enter the amount you would like to invest
form.disclaimer: By submitting this form I confirm that I understand that this is a non-binding reservation of interest in Lakay Vèt. I confirm that the information entered is true to the best of my knowledge and represents a genuine intent to invest in the company.

careers.subpar_1: We are constantly seeking passionate and motivated professionals that want to be a part of creating a strong, sustainable Haiti. If you are interested in joining our team, please explore open positions and apply.
careers.subpar_2: Our internship program is an awesome opportunity to explore working in an environment where each individual is challenged and given the opportunity to find creative solutions that can be applied to global sustainability issues. We accept both Haitian and international students in order to foster a rich cultural experience in addition to one that arms them with the knowledge and tools to be a part of creating a sustainable future for Haiti and the world.
careers.apply_by_phone: If you don't have access to a computer or would like to apply by phone please call (US) (408) 475-1728 or (HT) +509 49 01 33 11

who_we_are.body_1: Lakay Vèt S.A. is a Haitian owned and operated company dedicated to leading Haiti's resource management sector into a responsible and sustainable future. We convert waste into valuable resources for the people of Haiti and in the process promote agriculture, health and sustainable environmental practices. We don't just recycle, we extract value from waste and put that value right back into the local economy. To do this, we utilize custom designed, modular anaerobic digesters along with recycling technologies for non-organic materials (metals, plastics, foams, etc). We are working to expand our efforts and establish productive recycling facilities throughout Haiti.
who_we_are.body_2: Our processes have direct and measurable impact on the local economy including 1) providing an environmentally friendly, domestically produced and affordable biofertilizer to Haitian farmers, 2) diverting trash from streets, oceans, and unsafe dumping grounds, thereby promoting healthier and safer communities by reducing disease transmission pathways, 3) producing biogas that can be used as cooking fuel or in generators for electric power, and 4) providing local job opportunities for Haitians.

transparency.title: Values & Transparency
transparency.values_body: Lakay Vèt is founded on the principles of integrity, sustainability and community. These values shape the culture of the company and are upheld to the highest extent.
transparency.values_1c: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; moral uprightness.
transparency.values_2c: the ability to meet the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their needs
transparency.values_3c: a feeling of fellowship with others, as a result of sharing common attitudes, interests, and goals.
transparency.transparency_body: Transparency means telling the truth about your organization and your goals. Though Lakay Vèt is not a charitable organization and has no legal obligation to disclose certain information publicly, we embrace the values of accountability and transparency. Therefore, as a matter of ethical leadership we encourage inquiries and will disclose as much information as possible without causing harm to our company or its employees.
transparency.transparency_subpar_1: Investors have the right to know what their money is doing at any given time. Therefore, we commit to providing investors with a detailed quartely business performance report tailored to their requests.
transparency.transparency_subpar_2: If you have concerns or questions about who, how, when, where or why we do anything, we welcome your questions. We are dedicated to being as transparent as possible without jepordizing the well-being of our company and its employees.

press.title: Press
press.subnote: Please submit all press inquiries to
press.press_releases_body: Press releases are prepared and released as needed. If you have questions or concerns regarding this process, please let us know. See past press releases and our press kit below.
press.press_submissions_body: Though we are not a news agency, part of our mission is to help promote similar organizations including our formal partners. Please contact us for inquiries.

data.title: Open Data & Reports
data.body: This page is dedicated to promoting open data and resources about biodigestion in Haiti. We look forward to posting information and test results for feedstock analysis, biogas potential, mini-bioreactor designs, and more.

partners.title: Partnerships
partners.univ_partners_body_1: We partner with universities in Haiti and abroad that have programs supporting students studying recycling and waste to energy industries, especially anaerobic biodigestion, composting, and plastics recycling. We are working with students and departments that are focusing in areas including feedstock analysis, closed loop systems, safe digestate soil applications on traditional Haitian crops, and social and cultural impact of responsible waste management systems.
partners.ind_partners_body_1: We are exploring opportunities to partner with Haitian companies that are interested in the long-term sustainability of Haiti. This includes companies in the energy and agricultural sectors that can use our raw or processed byproducts such as electricity from biogas, cooking fuel from biogas, biofertilizer, recycled plastic pellets, and more.
